data.name: DescriptionInformationsWizard
data.value:
Indicate here the informations about the update. Fields in bold are required.
Vendor Name (Required): It is here that you define the name of the publisher of the update. For example: Oracle, Sun, Symantec, Adobe ...
Product Name (Required): Name of the upgraded product. For example: Java, Endpoint Protection 12, Flash Player ...
Title (Required): It is here that you define the title of the update. For example: Java 6 update 31, Symantec Endpoint Protection 12.1 MP1 RU1, Flash Player 11.2.0.233 ...
Description (Required): You can specify here information about the update. Such as, improvements, and bug fixes ...
More Info URL (Optional): Specify here a URL to a web page giving more information about the update.
Support URL (Optional): Specify here a URL to a web page support.
May require action by the user: Check the box if the update can request a user action.
Requires a network connection: Check if the update requires the network to install.
Classification:
Impact:
Restart behavior: Specify whether the need to update or not to restart the job to complete installation.
Id Security Bulletin (Optional): Specify the ID of the security bulletin provided by the publisher.
MSRC severity (Optional): Specify the MSRC code provided by the publisher.
CVE Id (Optional): Specify the CVE code provided by the publisher.
KB Article Id (Optional): Specify the number of KB article.
Command line (Optional): Indicate one or more parameters for the file update. Eg /q /s or /silent. For Msi file it is not necessary to specify the option to make the installation silent. Wsus does it automatically.
Return codes (Optional) : Only for .EXE files. Meaning of the code return at the end of the installation.
Click 'Next' to proceed to the next step.

data.name: DescriptionIsInstallableWizard
data.value:
Indicate here the rule or rules that allow clients computer to determine if the update is installable.
- Msi Product installed: Checks that the specified product is installed. Only the ProductCode is required, but the other attributes will be checked if they are supplied. - Processor Architecture: Determines whether the processor is x86, x64 or IA64. - Windows Version : Compare's the operating system's version information to specified values. Implemented using Win32 VerifyVersionInfo(). The Comparison attribute applies to MajorVersion, MinorVersion, BuildNumber, ServicePackMajor, and ServicePack Minor. If Comparison is omitted, it is assumed to be set to EqualTo. - Windows Language : Returns true if the operating system is localized to the specified language. Always returns false if the Windows Multilanguage User Interface (MUI) is installed. - File Exists : Checks for the existence of the specified file. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. If other optional metadata are specified, such as Version or Size, they must all match for this applicability rule to return true. - File Exists Prepend RegSz : Same as FileExists, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL. - File Version : Compares the specified file's version to the specified four-part version string. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. - File Version Prepend Reg Sz : Same as FileVersion, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL. - File Created Date : Compares the specified file's creation date to the specified value. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. - File Created Prepend RegSz : Same as FileCreated, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL. - File Modified Date : Compares the specified file's modification date to the specified value. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. - File Modified Prepend RegSz : Same as FileModified, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL. - File Size : Compares the specified file's size to the specified value. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. - File Size Prepend RegSz : Same as FileSize, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL. - Registry Key Exists : Checks for the existence of the specified registry subkey. - Registry Value Exists : Checks for the existence of the specified registry value. Checks the existence of the default value for the subkey when no value is specified. Checks that the value is of a specific type when a type is specified. The type must be REG_SZ if a value is not specified (the type of the default value of a subkey is always REG_SZ). - Reg_Dword Registry Key : Compares a specified REG_DWORD registry value to a specified number. - Reg_Expand_Sz Registry Key : Compares a specified REG_EXPAND_SZ registry value to a specified string. - Reg_Sz Registry Key : Compares a specified REG_SZ registry value to a specified string. - Reg Sz To Version Regsitry Key : Compares a specified REG_SZ registry value to a specified four-part version string. - Wmi Query : Executes a specified WMI query and evaluates to true if one or more results are returned, or false of zero results are returned.
* Delete rules at Package level : Allows you to ensure that only the rules that you set here applies. Recommended in the case of custom rules. If you only use the predefined rules in an MSI or MSP, leave unchecked.
Click 'Next' to proceed to the next step.

data.name: DescriptionIsInstalledWizard
data.value:
Indicate here the rule or rules that allow clients computer to determine if the update is already installed.
- Msi Product installed: Checks that the specified product is installed. Only the ProductCode is required, but the other attributes will be checked if they are supplied. - Processor Architecture: Determines whether the processor is x86, x64 or IA64. - Windows Version : Compare's the operating system's version information to specified values. Implemented using Win32 VerifyVersionInfo(). The Comparison attribute applies to MajorVersion, MinorVersion, BuildNumber, ServicePackMajor, and ServicePack Minor. If Comparison is omitted, it is assumed to be set to EqualTo. - Windows Language : Returns true if the operating system is localized to the specified language. Always returns false if the Windows Multilanguage User Interface (MUI) is installed. - File Exists : Checks for the existence of the specified file. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. If other optional metadata are specified, such as Version or Size, they must all match for this applicability rule to return true. - File Exists Prepend RegSz : Same as FileExists, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL. - File Version : Compares the specified file's version to the specified four-part version string. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. - File Version Prepend Reg Sz : Same as FileVersion, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL. - File Created Date : Compares the specified file's creation date to the specified value. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. - File Created Prepend RegSz : Same as FileCreated, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL. - File Modified Date : Compares the specified file's modification date to the specified value. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. - File Modified Prepend RegSz : Same as FileModified, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL. - File Size : Compares the specified file's size to the specified value. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. - File Size Prepend RegSz : Same as FileSize, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL. - Registry Key Exists : Checks for the existence of the specified registry subkey. - Registry Value Exists : Checks for the existence of the specified registry value. Checks the existence of the default value for the subkey when no value is specified. Checks that the value is of a specific type when a type is specified. The type must be REG_SZ if a value is not specified (the type of the default value of a subkey is always REG_SZ). - Reg_Dword Registry Key : Compares a specified REG_DWORD registry value to a specified number. - Reg_Expand_Sz Registry Key : Compares a specified REG_EXPAND_SZ registry value to a specified string. - Reg_Sz Registry Key : Compares a specified REG_SZ registry value to a specified string. - Reg Sz To Version Regsitry Key : Compares a specified REG_SZ registry value to a specified four-part version string. - Wmi Query : Executes a specified WMI query and evaluates to true if one or more results are returned, or false of zero results are returned.
* Delete rules at Package level : Allows you to ensure that only the rules that you set here applies. Recommended in the case of custom rules. If you only use the predefined rules in an MSI or MSP, leave unchecked.
Click 'Next' to proceed to the next step.

data.name: DescriptionRuleMsiProductInstalled
data.value:
Checks that the specified product is installed. Only the ProductCode is required, but the other attributes will be checked if they are supplied.
Msi code (required): MSI product code for the product to be checked. Format 12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012 Max version. (Optional): If present, this specified the maximum version of the product. If not present, there is no maximum version filter. Version Min. (Optional): If present, this specified the minimum version of the product. If not present, there is no minimum version filter. Language (Optional): If present, specifies the language to be filtered on. If not present, all languages are considered valid.

data.name: DescriptionRuleProcessorArchitecture
data.value: Checks that the system's processor is the specified architecture.

data.name: DescriptionUpdateFileWizard
data.value:
Indicate here the file or files to create the update. Fields in bold are required.
Update File (Required): Select a msi, msp or exe file corresponding to the binary update.
Additional files (Optional): Select a file or files needed for the application of the update. For example configuration files or answer file.
Click 'Next' to proceed to the next step.

data.name: openFileDialogueUpdateFile
data.value: All accepted files|*.msi;*.msp;*.exe|MSI Files|*.msi|MSP Files|*.msp|EXE Files|*.exe

data.name: RegKeyLoop
data.value: Value Of Every sub Reg Key

data.name: RegSzToVersion
data.value: Reg Sz To Version Regsitry Key

data.name: DescriptionRuleWindowsVersion
data.value:
Compare's the operating system's version information to specified values. Implemented using Win32 VerifyVersionInfo(). The Comparison attribute applies to MajorVersion, MinorVersion, BuildNumber, ServicePackMajor, and ServicePack Minor. If Comparison is omitted, it is assumed to be set to EqualTo.
You must set at least 'Major Version' and/or 'Product Type'.
Caution: A domain controller appear with a 'product' = 'domain controller' and not 'Server'.
Comparison: Logical operator comparison. By default, the operator is 'Equal To'.
Easy Selection : Presets at your disposal.
Major Version: Major version of the operating system.
Minor Revision: Minor version of the operating system.
Build Number: Build of the Operating System.
Product: Determines whether this is a workstation, server or domain controller.
Service Pack Major: Major service pack version.
Service Pack Minor: Minor service pack version.

data.name: DescriptionWindowsLanguage
data.value: Returns true if the operating system is localized to the specified language. Always returns false if the Windows Multilanguage User Interface (MUI) is installed.

data.name: DescriptionFileExists
data.value:
Checks for the existence of the specified file. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file. If other optional metadata are specified, such as Version or Size, they must all match for this applicability rule to return true.
Known folder (Optional): List of predefined folder whose location may vary from one OS to another. File Path (Required): Full path to the file search (260 characters max.). File Version (optional): File Version. Creation Date (Optional): Creation date of the file. Modified Date (Optional): Modified date of the file. File Size (Optional): Size in bytes of the file. Language (optional): Language of the file.

data.name: DescriptionFileVersion
data.value:
Compares the specified file's version to the specified four-part version string. If Csidl is specified, the Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file.
Standard folder (Optional) : List of predefined file whose location may vary from one OS to another. Path to the file (Required) : Full path to the file search (260 characters max.). Version (Required) : File Version.

data.name: DescriptionFileCreated
data.value:
Compares the specified file's creation date to the specified value. If Csidl is specified, the MSUS Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file.
Standard folder (Optional): List of predefined file whose location may vary from one OS to another. Path to the file (Required): Full path to the file search (260 characters max.).

data.name: DescriptionFileVersionPrependRegSz
data.value:
Same as FileVersion, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL.
Standard folder (Optional) : List of predefined file whose location may vary from one OS to another. Path to the file (Required) : Full path to the file search (260 characters max.). Version (Required ): File Version.

data.name: WsusConnectionException
data.value: Failed to connect to the server. Verify that the server is started and connection parameters are valid.

data.name: EditGroupTypeAnd
data.value: Do you want to link rules by logical operator "And" ?

data.name: EditGroupTypeOr
data.value: Do you want to link rules by logical operator "Or" ?

data.name: NeedServerSettings
data.value: You need to provide settings for, at least, one server.

data.name: CertificateSuccessfullyGenerate
data.value: The certificate has been successfully generated. Don't forget to restart the Wsus Server.

data.name: CertificateSuccessfullyLoaded
data.value: The certificate has been successfully loaded. Don't forget to restart the Wsus Server.

data.name: CertificateSuccessfullySaved
data.value: The certificate has been successfully saved.

data.name: FailedToConnectToServer
data.value: Failed to connect to the server.

data.name: DescriptionFileExistsPrependRegSz
data.value:
Same as FileExists, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL.
Hkey_Local_Machine (Mandatory) : Hive of the registry where is the name of the directory. Value (Mandatory): Name of the registry key where is the name of the directory. File Name (Mandatory) : Name of the file to search for (260 char. max.). File Version (Optional) : Version of the file. Creation Date (Optional) : Creation date of the file. Modified Date (Optional) : Modification date of the file. Size (Optional) : Size of the file (bytes). Language (Optional) : Language of the file.

data.name: DescriptionRegKeyExists
data.value:
Checks for the existence of the specified registry subkey.
For exemple : Software\Microsoft\Windows in HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE
If you want to test the existence of a value such as: SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\{23170F69-40C1-2702-0920-000001000000}\DisplayName in HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE Then use the rule : "Registry Value Exists".

data.name: DescriptionRegValueExists
data.value:
Checks for the existence of the specified registry value. Checks the existence of the default value for the subkey when no value is specified. Checks that the value is of a specific type when a type is specified. The type must be REG_SZ if a value is not specified (the type of the default value of a subkey is always REG_SZ).
Checks the existence of the default value for the subkey when no value is specified. Checks that the value is of a specific type when a type is specified. the type must be REG_SZ if a value is not specified.

data.name: DescriptionRuleRegDword
data.value:
Compares a specified REG_DWORD registry value to a specified number.
SubKey : A registry subkey, such as "Software\Microsoft\Windows". Must be between 1 and 255 characters.
Value : A registry value name, such as "CurrentBuildNumber". Must be between 0 and 16383 characters.
Data : A REG_DWORD registry value. Must be between 0 and uint.maximum

data.name: DescriptionRuleRegExpandSz
data.value:
Compares a specified REG_EXPAND_SZ registry value to a specified string.
SubKey : A registry subkey, such as "Software\Microsoft\Windows". Must be between 1 and 255 characters.
Value : A registry value name, such as "CurrentBuildNumber". Must be between 0 and 16383 characters.
Data : A REG_EXPAND_SZ registry value. Must be between 0 and 16383 characters.

data.name: DescriptionRuleRegSz
data.value:
Compares a specified REG_SZ registry value to a specified string.
SubKey : A registry subkey, such as "Software\Microsoft\Windows". Must be between 1 and 255 characters.
Value : A registry value name, such as "CurrentBuildNumber". Must be between 0 and 16383 characters.
Data : A REG_Sz registry value. Must be between 0 and 16383 characters.

data.name: DescriptionRuleRegSzToVersion
data.value:
Compares a specified REG_SZ registry value to a specified four-part version string.
SubKey : A registry subkey, such as "Software\Microsoft\Windows". Must be between 1 and 255 characters.
Value : A registry value name, such as "CurrentBuildNumber". Must be between 0 and 16383 characters.
Data : A REG_SZ registry value. Should match the pattern 0...65535, 0...65535, 0...65535, 0...65535

data.name: DescriptionRuleWmiQuery
data.value:
Executes a specified WMI query and evaluates to true if one or more results are returned, or false of zero results are returned.
Namespace (Optional) : The WMI namespace of the request.
WqlQuery (Required) : The WMI WQL Query.

data.name: DescriptionRuleMsiFeatureInstalledForProduct
data.value: Checks that the specified feature(s) are installed for one (optionally all) of the specified products.

data.name: DescriptionFileCreatedPrependRegSz
data.value:
Same as FileCreated, but the Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL.
Hkey_Local_Machine (Required) : Hive of the registry where is the name of the directory. Value (Required) : Name of the registry key where is the name of the directory. File Name (Required) : Name of the file to search for (260 char. max.). Creation Date (Required) : Creation date of the file.

data.name: DescriptionFileModified
data.value:
Compares the specified file's modification date to the specified value. If Csidl is specified, the MSUS Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file.
- Known Folders (Optional) : A list of wellknown folders.
- File Path (Required) : The path to the file.
- Comparison (Required) : The comparison operator.
- Modification Date (Required) : Date of modification.

data.name: DescriptionFileSize
data.value:
Compares the specified file's size to the specified value. If Csidl is specified, the MSUS Client will call Win32 SHGetFolderPath to retrieve the CSIDL and prepend it to Path to form the actual path to the file.
- Known Folders (Optional) : A list of wellknown folders.
- File Path (Required) : The path to the file.
- Comparison (Required) : The comparison operator.
- File Size (Required) : The size of the file, in bytes, for the comparison.

data.name: DescriptionFileSizePrependRegSz
data.value: Same as FileSize, but the MSUS Client will prepend the specified REG_SZ value from the registry instead of a CSIDL.

data.name: DescriptionRuleMsiPatchInstalledForProduct
data.value:
Checks that the specified patch is installed for the specified product.
Patch Code (required) : MSI patch code for the patch whose install status is to be checked. Format 12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012
Product Code (required) : MSI product code for the product to be checked. Format 12345678-1234-1234-1234-123456789012
Reverse the rule: If check, evaluates the rule then inverts the result.
Max version. (Optional): If present, this specified the maximum version of the product. If not present, there is no maximum version filter.
Version Min. (Optional): If present, this specified the minimum version of the product. If not present, there is no minimum version filter.
Language (Optional): If present, specifies the language to be filtered on. If not present, all languages are considered valid.

data.name: CredentialFailed
data.value: Failed to connect with provided crendentials. Do you want to continue to use these credentials (may lock the account) ?

data.name: CertificateAbstent
data.value: You do not have a certificate. You will not be able to publish updates.

data.name: CertificateExpired
data.value: The certificate has expired. You will not be able to publish updates.

data.name: CertificateInvalid
data.value: The certificate is invalid. You will not be able to publish updates.

data.name: CertificateNearExpiration
data.value: Your certificate will expire in less than 30 days.

data.name: CertificateNotYetValid
data.value: The certificate is not yet valid. You will not be able to publish updates.

data.name: CredentialUseSameAsApplication
data.value: Features connecting to remote computers will use the same credentials than the application.

data.name: CredentialUseSpecified
data.value: Features connecting to remote computers will use crendentials that have been specified in the options.

data.name: CredentialWillBeAsk
data.value: Features connecting to remote computers will ask you for credentials.

data.name: CredentialWillUse
data.value: Features connecting to remote computers will use this login :

data.name: ShowInWsusConsole
data.value: Make it visible in Wsus Console

data.name: SearchPrerequisite
data.value: Do you want to search which update(s) has mark this update as a prerequisite ?

data.name: ChangingLanguage
data.value: Changing language will take effect after restarting the application.

data.name: UnableToFindShowPendingUpdates
data.value: Unable to find the file 'Show Pending Updates.exe' in the Application's folder.

data.name: AddAutomaticallyThisServer
data.value: Wsus Server has been detected on this machine, therefore it has been automatically add on the top of the server list. To add other servers go to Tools -> Settings.

data.name: AskForSupport
data.value:
You can send support data to the author to help improve this application.
Add a comment and click 'Yes' button to send your comment. To see which informations will be sent, click on the link at bottom left.
Thank you !

data.name: WentWrong
data.value:
Oups, Something went wrong !
Please, help the author to fix this by sending anonymous debug informations. To see which informations will be send, click on the link at bottom left.
Thank you for your participation !

data.name: CertificateFailedtoBeLoaded
data.value: Failed to load the certificate. Check the file.

data.name: SolveCertificateProblemBeforePublishing
data.value: There is a problem with the certificate, solve it before publishing an update.

data.name: ServerAndConsoleVersionMismatch
data.value: Server version is different from console version. You won't be able to publish/revise updates.

data.name: UninstallationDisallowed
data.value: Some selected updates does not support uninstallation.

data.name: CantAddUNCPath
data.value: You can't add files from an UNC path (Starting by \\server\partage...)

data.name: AdditionnalFileAlreadyExist
data.value: The following file can't be add because there is another file with this name :

data.name: UnableToGetLogonUser
data.value: Unable to get the current logon user.

data.name: MustBeWsusAdmin
data.value: You must be part of 'Wsus Administrators' group to perform this operation.

data.name: MustHaveAdminPrivileges
data.value: You must have admin rights on this computer to perform this operation.

data.name: AlreadyAnUpdateWithThisID
data.value: There's already an update with this Package ID. No import will be perform.

data.name: SelectOneAndOnlyOneUpdate
data.value: Select one and only one update...

data.name: DeletionCannotBeCancel
data.value: Deletion cannot be cancel. Are you sure you want to delete ?

data.name: UpdatedCatalogAvailable
data.value: An update is available for a/some Catalog(s)... Do you want to see difference between old and new catalogs ?

data.name: MustRunLocallyToGenerateSelfSignedCertificateOn6.3
data.value: Since Microsoft has disable the ability, for Wsus 6.3 and beyond, to issue a self-signed cerrtificate, you have to run WPP locally on the Wsus server, to allow WPP to generate this certificate.

data.name: CantPublishDetectoids
data.value: "Detectoids" cannot be published or imported in Wsus. If you know how to publish or import Detectoids, please contact the author (package.publisher@free.fr).

data.name: ConfirmeUpdateDeletion
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete these updates ?

data.name: XmlSchemaValidationException
data.value: An error occurred while checking the meta data of the file you are trying to publish. This problem occurs mostly in publishing invalid MSI or MSP files.

data.name: ErrorGetMetaData
data.value: An error occurs while trying to retrieve MetaData for this update. Try to decline then delete this update. And try to republish the update.

data.name: DescriptionApplicabilityMetadata
data.value: Experienced users can edit metadata defined by the editor.

data.name: ErrorSettingMaxCabSize
data.value: An error occured while setting Max Cab Size.

data.name: ChangeMaxCabSizeForFile
data.value: At least one file's size is greater than the Max Cab Size defined in the Wsus Settings. If you continue, you may receive the error : "Verification of signature failed for file...". You can change this setting here :

data.name: ChangeMaxCabSizeSetting
data.value: If you receive an "Verification of signature failed for file...", when you try to publish big file, you can increase the limit set into Wsus.

data.name: AreYouSureToWantToOverwriteCurrentCertificate
data.value: You already have a valid certificate. Are you sure to want to overwrite this certificate ?

data.name: TheFileIsA0ByteFileSize
data.value: The file is a 0 byte file Size. The download may have failed.
